chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
remove_zero_den: list (nat * nat) -> list (nat * nat)
l: list (nat * nat)

Goal:
fractran_regular (remove_zero_den l)

Premises:
fractran_regular = fun l => Forall (fun c : nat * nat => snd c <> 0) l : list (nat * nat) -> Prop Arguments fractran_regular _%list_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
FRACTRAN_REG_PROBLEM = {l : list (nat * nat) & {_ : nat | fractran_regular l}} : Set
fractran_stop = fun l (x : nat) => forall z : nat, ~ l /F/ x → z : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_stop _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_steps = fun l => rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
fractran_step_inv : forall (P : list (nat * nat)) (x y : nat), P /F/ x → y -> exists l (p q : nat) (r : list (nat * nat)), P = l ++ (p, q) :: r /\ (forall u v : nat, In (u, v) l -> ~ divides v (u * x)) /\ q * y = p * x
fractran_terminates = fun l (x : nat) => exists y : nat, fractran_compute l x y /\ fractran_stop l y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_terminates _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_compute = fun l (x y : nat) => exists n : nat, fractran_steps l n x y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_compute _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_step_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
fractran_step_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
Inductive fractran_step : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop := in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y | in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y Arguments fractran_step _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_0 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_1 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
prime.expand = fix expand (p : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => x + p * expand p l0 end : nat -> list nat -> nat Arguments prime.expand _%nat_scope _%list_scope
split : forall A B : Type, list (A * B) -> list A * list B
split_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (n : nat) (d : A * B), nth n l d = (nth n (fst (split l)) (fst d), nth n (snd (split l)) (snd d))
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y
Ring_polynom.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> list R -> Prop
fractran_step_bound : forall l, fractran_regular l -> {k : nat | forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y <= k * x}
in_split_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (snd p) (snd (split l))
in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
fractran_step_cons_inv : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y < -> q * y = p * x \/ ~ divides q (p * x) /\ l /F/ x → y
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
Tauto.radd_term : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> Term' * Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot + list Annot
pos_not_diag : forall n : nat, list (pos n * pos n)
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
fractan_stop_cons_inv : forall (p q : nat) l (x : nat), fractran_stop ((p, q) :: l) x < -> ~ divides q (p * x) /\ fractran_stop l x
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe2
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
flat_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> list B) -> list A -> list B
app : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> list A
Ring_polynom.MFactor : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C * Ring_polynom.Pol C
mul_pos_inj_l : forall q x y : nat, q <> 0 -> q * x = q * y -> x = y
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
incl : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> Prop
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall cdiv : C -> C ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P1) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 cO cI cadd cmul ceqb cdiv P1 cM1 P2 n))
Ring_polynom.POneSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
